title: Rick Woods
text:
Rick L. Woods (born November 16, 1959) is a former professional <a href="American%20football">football</a> player, a <a href="defensive%20back">defensive back</a> in the <a href="National%20Football%20League">NFL</a>. He played <a href="Safety%20%28American%20football%20position%29">safety</a> and <a href="cornerback">cornerback</a> for six seasons for the <a href="Pittsburgh%20Steelers">Pittsburgh Steelers</a> (1982–86) and the <a href="Tampa%20Bay%20Buccaneers">Tampa Bay Buccaneers</a> (1987).
Woods grew up in Boise and played <a href="high%20school%20football">high school football</a> at <a href="Boise%20High%20School">Boise High</a> and <a href="college%20football">college football</a> at <a href="Boise%20State%20Broncos%20football">Boise State</a>, where he was a standout defensive back and punt returner. He was a member of the <a href="NCAA%20Division%20I%20Football%20Championship">I-AA national championship</a> team in <a href="1980%20Boise%20State%20Broncos%20football%20team">1980</a>, and the <a href="1981%20Boise%20State%20Broncos%20football%20team">1981 team</a> that reached the national semifinals. As a punt returner at BSU, he rarely called a <a href="Fair%20catch%23American%20football">fair catch</a>, earning him the nickname "Riverboat Gambler." In the <a href="1982%20NFL%20Draft">1982 NFL Draft</a>, Woods was selected in the fourth round (97th overall) by the Pittsburgh Steelers.
